comments:
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.editor/plugin.xml contributes the EvaluatePathAction
for all EDataObjects. This is a problem for two reasons:
1. Anywhere clients present EMF/SDO-based objects in a UI, this undesired action
appears in the context menu of their application.
2. The action blows up, throwing an NPE when invoked on a client's objects.

java.lang.NullPointerException

Jared,

That's a very good point.  We should ensure that this action is only applicable
in the sample editor itself. 

I'd like to understand the null pointer exception too, since that should never
happen. Which version/driver of EMF are you using?  (The line number is not
matching my version from HEAD.)

The line is a little bit off, but I think it's at

  return resource.getURI().appendFragment(resource.getURIFragment(eObject));

so probably you have a resource with a null URI.  We don't expect that but I see
we should...

The change to eliminate the global action and make it specific to the datagraph
editor is committed to CVS.
Will this fix be in the next EMF integration build?

Yes.  When we change the state to assigned, that always means it's queued up for
the next build.
